SENT.plain: PURPOSE: To report the occurrence of bilateral macular hemorrhage following the use of azathioprine for immunosuppression in a corneal transplant recipient
METHODS: The patient underwent therapeutic penetrating keratoplasty for progressive fungal keratitis in his left eye
Although the infection did not recur, the graft failed with vascularization of the cornea in three quadrants
He underwent repeat penetrating keratoplasty 2 years later and was treated with azathioprine (100 mg daily) to enhance graft survival
Four months after instituting azathioprine therapy, he developed aplastic anemia and macular hemorrhage in both eyes
RESULTS: Fluorescein angiography revealed a preretinal location of the macular hemorrhage

After cessation of azathioprine therapy and treatment with blood component replacement, hematological parameters improved and the macular hemorrhage cleared with good visual recovery during the next 2 months
CONCLUSION: This report highlights the serious ocular and systemic complications that can occur following the use of systemic immunosuppressants after ophthalmic surgery
